item.title: No deal in place for Fury comeback
item.description: Tyson Fury says he will come out of retirement in 2026 but there is currently no date or venue in place for the heavyweight to make his comeback.

item.title: Fury comes out of retirement... again
item.description: Former heavyweight world champion Tyson Fury announces he will return to boxing in 2026, bringing an end to his latest spell of retirement.

item.title: Joshua posts update for first time since car crash
item.description: Anthony Joshua posts on social media for the first time since he was injured in a car crash that killed two of his close friends in Nigeria.

item.title: Serrano retains world titles in homecoming win
item.description: Featherweight world champion Amanda Serrano marks her Puerto Rico homecoming with a hard-earned but dominant points win over Reina Tellez.

item.title: Joshua flies back to UK after Nigeria car crash
item.description: Former world heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua flies back to the UK following a fatal car crash that killed two of his close friends in Nigeria.

item.title: Joshua's driver charged over Nigeria crash that killed two
item.description: The former heavyweight champion was a passenger in the crash, which killed two of his team members on Monday.

item.title: Joshua discharged from hospital after Nigeria car crash
item.description: Two of the former world champion's closest friends were killed in the accident on Monday.

item.title: Paul loses WBA cruiserweight ranking after Joshua defeat
item.description: Jake Paul drops out of the WBA's cruiserweight rankings after losing his heavyweight bout against Anthony Joshua last month.

item.title: 'A credit to Irish boxing' - McCullagh dies aged 25
item.description: Tributes have been paid to Belfast boxer Paul McCullagh Jr, who has passed away aged 25 after a short illness.

item.title: Dickens to make Dublin title defence against Cacace
item.description: James Dickens will make the first defence of his WBA super-featherweight title against Belfast's Anthony Cacace in Dublin in March.

item.title: 'A sombre and sobering end to the year' - Bunce on fatal crash
item.description: BBC Radio 5 Live's boxing analyst Steve Bunce on the fatal car accident that killed two of Anthony Joshua's close friends.

item.title: 'Deeply missed' - Hearn's tribute to Joshua's friends Ghami and Latz
item.description: Matchroom promoter Eddie Hearn says Anthony Joshua's friends Sina Ghami and Latif "Latz" Ayodele, who were killed in a car crash in Nigeria, will be "deeply missed".

item.title: Watch every episode
item.description: Natasha Jonas and Chris Eubank Jr feature

item.title: I can't imagine what Joshua is going through - Bunce
item.description:
Boxing expert Steve Bunce says he can't imagine the "type of condition" Anthony Joshua is in following a crash that killed two of his close friends and team members. Sina Ghami and Latif Ayodele died when the vehicle they were in collided with a stationary truck in Lagos, Nigeria.
Sina Ghami and Latif Ayodele died when the vehicle they were in collided with a stationary truck in Nigeria.

item.title: Joshua knocks out Paul in one-sided fight
item.description: Anthony Joshua defeats YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul as he secures a comfortable win via a sixth-round stoppage in Miami.

item.title: 'Unthinkable' that Jake Paul can win - Lewis
item.description: Lennox Lewis tells BBC Sport he can't see the "unthinkable" happening, and that Anthony Joshua will beat Jake Paul on Friday night.

item.title: Paul 'massively deluded' to think he can win - Hearn
item.description: Jake Paul is "petrified" of fighting Anthony Joshua, promoter Eddie Hearn tells BBC Sport.

item.title: 'I'm carrying boxing on my back' - AJ
item.description: Anthony Joshua believes he is "carrying boxing on his back" for his heavyweight bout against Jake Paul.

item.title: 'Out of the ring, he was fighting another fight'
item.description: How former European champion James Cook changed lives through his tireless work at one of London's oldest youth clubs.

item.title: Small halls in crisis - boxing's lifeblood is struggling to breathe
item.description: Small-hall boxing has long been considered the sport's lifeblood. But right now, it is struggling for survival. BBC Sport finds out why.

item.title: For four days, I didn't know if my family was alive - Williamson
item.description: British boxer Troy Williamson - who faces Callum Simpson live on BBC on Saturday - reveals how Hurricane Melissa ruined his family home and bar in Jamaica.

item.title: 'Paul was sitting there waiting to get hit' - Lewis leads big-name reaction
item.description: Former heavyweight champion Lennox Lewis believes Jake Paul 's fitness played a role in his sixth-round stoppage defeat against Anthony Joshua.

item.title: 'They told me to choose between my hijab and boxing'
item.description: How Germany's Zeina Nassar - who makes her pro debut on Wednesday - rewrote boxing's rules about fighting in a hijab.

item.title: Church told me I was possessed by demons aged 12 - Benn
item.description: Conor Benn tells BBC Sport about growing up in an "extreme" Christian school, being told he was "demon-possessed" and how he had to rebuild a relationship with his father Nigel.

item.title: What next for heavyweight division after TKV win?
item.description: Jeamie 'TKV' Tshikeva's win over Frazer Clarke adds a new dimension to the British heavyweight scene, but what about the rest of the world's big hitters?

item.title: 'You're under arrest' - how Ngamba made history against all odds
item.description: Cindy Ngamba shares her incredible story from refugee to Olympic medallist.

item.title: 'I wouldn't wish what I went through on my worst enemy'
item.description: Undisputed middleweight boxing world champion Claressa Shields opens up about her harrowing journey to the top of her sport.

item.title: From rock bottom to three world titles at 37
item.description: Natasha Jonas tells her story, including what it took to come back and win three world titles at 37.

item.title: Being a Eubank, living up to dad and dealing with grief
item.description: Born To Brawl: Chris Eubank Jr tells his story of grief and living up to his dad

item.title: Are Prince Naseem Hamed's sons coming for his throne?
item.description: Get to know the Hameds' journey ahead of Aadam Hamed's debut on the Oleksandr Usyk v Daniel Dubois undercard.

item.title: Tyson rates him: Is traveller Dennis McCann boxing's next superstar?
item.description: Tyson Fury tips traveller boxer Dennis ‘The Menace’ McCann as future world champion

item.title: 'I gave everything to boxing and still have nothing'
item.description: Heather Hardy tells BBC Sport how she is adapting to life outside of boxing after the former world champion was left with a life-threatening injury.

item.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
item.description: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

item.title: Cameron relives Taylor epic in Dublin
item.description: Chantelle Cameron relives her historic victory over Katie Taylor before Saturday's rematch in Dublin.
